item.title: Lost Paradise: Remembering the Polynesian Hotel and Casino in Vintage Las Vegas
item.description:
A Tropical Dream on Tropicana: The Polynesian’s Brief Reign

The 1980s and early 90s in Las Vegas were a period of intense experimentation. The Strip was exploding with mega-resorts, but smaller properties on the periphery, like those along Tropicana Avenue, fought to find their niche. Enter the Polynesian Hotel and Casino, a bold attempt to transport visitors to a South Pacific paradise, albeit on a modest scale. Opened in 1985, it occupied the spot at 115 East Tropicana, a location previously home to a Howard Johnsonâ€™s Motor Lodge.
